column2: A form of asbestos once used to make Kent cigarette filters has caused a high percentage of cancer deaths among a group of workers exposed to it more than 30 years ago, researchers reported.
column3: A form of asbestos once used to make Kent cigarette filters has caused a high percentage of cancer deaths among a group of workers exposed to it more than 30 years ago , researchers reported .

column2: The asbestos fiber, crocidolite, is unusually resilient once it enters the lungs, with even brief exposures to it causing symptoms that show up decades later, researchers said.
column3: The asbestos fiber , crocidolite , is unusually resilient once it enters the lungs , with even brief exposures to it causing symptoms that show up decades later , researchers said .

column2: When it's time for their biannual powwow, the nation's manufacturing titans typically jet off to the sunny confines of resort towns like Boca Raton and Hot Springs.

column2: The National Association of Manufacturers settled on the Hoosier capital of Indianapolis for its fall board meeting.
column3: The National Association of Manufacturers settled on the Hoosier capital of Indianapolis for its fall board meeting .

column2: And the city decided to treat its guests more like royalty or rock stars than factory owners.
column3: And the city decided to treat its guests more like royalty or rock stars than factory owners .

column2: The idea, of course: to prove to 125 corporate decision makers that the buckle on the Rust Belt isn't so rusty after all, that it's a good place for a company to expand.

column3: The next morning , with a police escort , busloads of executives and their wives raced to the Indianapolis Motor Speedway , unimpeded by traffic or red lights .

column3: A buffet breakfast was held in the museum , where food and drinks are banned to everyday visitors .

column3: This time , it was for dinner and dancing -- a block away .

column2: South Korea registered a trade deficit of $101 million in October, reflecting the country's economic sluggishness, according to government figures released Wednesday.
column3: South Korea registered a trade deficit of $ 101 million in October , reflecting the country 's economic sluggishness , according to government figures released Wednesday .

column2: Preliminary tallies by the Trade and Industry Ministry showed another trade deficit in October, the fifth monthly setback this year, casting a cloud on South Korea's export-oriented economy.
column3: Preliminary tallies by the Trade and Industry Ministry showed another trade deficit in October , the fifth monthly setback this year , casting a cloud on South Korea 's export-oriented economy .

column2: Exports in October stood at $5.29 billion, a mere 0.7% increase from a year earlier, while imports increased sharply to $5.39 billion, up 20% from last October.
column3: Exports in October stood at $ 5.29 billion , a mere 0.7 % increase from a year earlier , while imports increased sharply to $ 5.39 billion , up 20 % from last October .

column2: South Korea's economic boom, which began in 1986, stopped this year because of prolonged labor disputes, trade conflicts and sluggish exports.

column2: Government officials said exports at the end of the year would remain under a government target of $68 billion.
column3: Government officials said exports at the end of the year would remain under a government target of $ 68 billion .

column2: Despite the gloomy forecast, South Korea has recorded a trade surplus of $71 million so far this year.
column3: Despite the gloomy forecast , South Korea has recorded a trade surplus of $ 71 million so far this year .

column2: From January to October, the nation's accumulated exports increased 4% from the same period last year to $50.45 billion.
column3: From January to October , the nation 's accumulated exports increased 4 % from the same period last year to $ 50.45 billion .

column2: Imports were at $50.38 billion, up 19%.
